intro: Triplophyllum boliviense, commonly known as the Bolivian triple-leaf plant, is a species native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its unique trifoliate leaves composed of three leaflets. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
